response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Array Sorting\", \"description\": \"Write a function `sort_array` that takes an array of integers as input and sorts it in ascending order. The array may contain duplicate elements.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef sort_array(arr: list[int]) -> list[int]:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `arr` (list[int]): A list of integers that needs to be sorted.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns a new list containing the same elements as the input list, but in ascending order.\\n\", \"code\": \"def sort_array(arr: list[int]) -> list[int]:\\n    return sorted(arr)\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert sort_array([3, 1, 4, 1, 5]) == [1, 1, 3, 4, 5]\", \"assert sort_array([]) == []\", \"assert sort_array([-1, 0, 2]) == [-1, 0, 2]\", \"assert sort_array([5, 4, 3, 2, 1]) == [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]\"] }"
